You can wrangle tasks like a pro, juggling them with style and pizzazz and don't just handle big projects, you conquer them with multiple priorities like a design superhero!
If you're the master of these skills, you're the creative powerhouse we're looking for!

Show your graphic design skills with a portfolio that highlights your creativity.
Lead and inspire a design team, providing guidance.
Pay attention to detail for accurate and quality design work.
Collaborate effectively in a diverse team, contributing innovative ideas.
Handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment, maintaining high standards.
Organize, meet deadlines, and communicate well with clients.
Understand digital design principles and user interface.
Stay updated on design trends and emerging tech, incorporating as needed.
Bonus: Experience with After Effects for added visual impact.

Qualifications and Experience

Minimum 5 years of diverse design experience.
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
Portfolio showcasing creative solutions in both digital and print design.
Experience leading, mentoring, and collaborating with a design team.
Worked on projects that highlight a strong attention to detail producing accurate, high-quality work.
Effective collaboration in a fast-paced environment.
Experience managing multiple projects and deadlines.
Have a proven understanding of digital design principles and UI.
Experience with art direction, including collaboration with photographers and illustrators.

Global client portfolio

About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
Position Summary 
Our Program Managers bring value to our clients by passionately and professionally serving the best interests of our clients and agency by scoping, planning and managing the effective and efficient delivery of our integrated solutions; campaigns, events, experiences, platforms, content, products and services. They are an invaluable resource to the client teams (Delivery leads in particular) in helping to define and manage overall scopes of work, annual/project-based agency resources based on client budgets and project needs, and the integration with key partners throughout the process. Program Managers add value by interrogating every client brief and assignment and striving to solve our clients more significant business problems, not just the immediate request at hand. They are the trusted partner and point of contact for senior/management level clients, partnering with account leadership to deliver operational efficiencies, delivery excellence, project governance, resource optimization to increase speed-to-market and ROI for our clients and the agency.
What Youll Do 

Partner with the brand, Category Business Leads and Project Leads within the client structures to scope, plan and manage individual projects and programs of work with maximum efficiency and impact and project delivery
Roadmap & Demand: Management of long-term experience roadmap, quarterly demand and detailed content calendars in partnership with client digital lead.
Draft Key Milestones and Project Plans outlining all detailed deliverables and timings per workstream
Manage all stakeholders and day to day project contact with senior/management level clients  this includes all teams working on the project  coordinating between all the various role players and agencies to ensure a smooth and seamless flow of communication, information, documentation and logistical aspects of project delivery
Own/champion/enforce agency core process (Think/Create/Realise/Optimise)
Effective scoping based on mandatory customer/business outcomes and creative ambitions, assessed against client budgets and timelines
Effective scope management and communicating change requests, and managing scope-creep to avoid missed deadlines and cost overages
Ensure all agency briefs are complete and clear (context, mandatory information, deliverables, timelines, budgets etc.) before engaging managed resources
Enforce internal Quality Assurance (QA) processes and measure to avoid/minimize duplication of effort and protect agency reputation
Co-own the project budgets to manage costs and deliverables as well as staffing resources
Responsible or assigning responsibility for all meeting communication and preparation, i.e. Agendas, Presentations, Meeting notes, etc
Develop and maintain clear and complete Statement of Work (SoW) and Functional/Technical documentation (tech projects)
Effectively present and justify SoW, including timelines, budgets, resource plans and general delivery ecosystems (integrations and partnerships)
Maintain up-to-date resource, project information and reporting in Delivery Power Tools (Workfront, JIRA, Other) for effective, data-informed project and resource management and reporting
Scheduling of all meeting routines, i.e. regular meetings as agreed with Project Team (weekly/bi-weekly, reviews, etc) and based on the phase that the project is in, i.e. daily check ins/stand ups may be required at some point. This includes meetings with the Project team as well as internal meetings
Manage Project Risk  responsible for flagging and tracking all risks that could impact on the successful delivery of the project and developing contingency plans (Manage Risk Register)
Serve as a mentor/coach to more junior team members and supporting the development of future Program and Account Managers
Help facilitate and maintain a collaborative and inclusive work environment where diversity and talent, and flexibility in workflows become key strengths in driving highly creative, effective and efficient outcomes
Understand & respect every departments role in delivering great work and building relationships
Governance & Optimization - Safeguard operating model and management of change ensuring application, implementation and ongoing optimisation within OU/market cluster context. Ensure that the team complies with all teams' processes
Together with the Brand Integration Lead and Project Lead help navigate the Project Team through the Experience Loop, particularly around timings
Responsible for the storing, filing and access of all project documents
Work closely with the Brand Project Lead on completing the Project Statement in MAP and ensure all financial processes, controls are adhered for the Studio for project work
Exceptional resource planning and team management skills
Operations Co-ordination & Delivery - Triage of production ready briefs/requests to DigiOps delivery team, tracking and coordinating delivery & go-live timelines between delivery team & client digital leads.
Change champion: Management of change & ensuring communication around transformation within OU/Market clusters.

What Youll Need  

4  7 years of related experience in program/project/account management, with client facing industry experience managing the making and delivery of great work
At least 1 formal qualification/certification in Professional Program/Project Management (or equivalent) such as Agile Certified Professional (ACP) SCRUM, Project Management Professional (PMP), Program Management Professional (PgMP), Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM)
Experienced in delivering programs programs of work and integrated campaigns in minimum 3 of the following verticals (not necessarily on the same project): Brand Development, B2C/B2B Advertising, Content Marketing, Retail, CPG, Digital/Social Advertising, Digital Transformation, Technology Platforms, PR & Influence, Experience Design, Events and Experiential Marketing, Integrated Production
Demonstrable experience in senior client relationship management
Demonstrable experience in integrated, digital and traditional production
Demonstrable capability to deliver integrated projects with multiple deliverables and stakeholder within allocated timelines and budgets
Working knowledge of Agency operations, including Finance and Commercial processes and compliance frameworks
An in-depth understanding and appreciation of the creative process  championing great work
Demonstrable knowledge of client-side marketing operations
Experience forming strong relationships at all levels, internal and with clients/partners
Proven negotiation skills
Demonstrable risk assessment, mitigation and management experience (project level)
Curious, a lifelong learner, good listener, someone who reads people and those in a room well and adapts their style and response accordingly
Calm and confident under pressure
Well-organized, punctual and accountable with great presentation skills

How Well Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. Well empower you with the tools youll need to succeed. Well give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. Well support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And well provide opportunities for you to do work of which youll be proud, with people youll be proud to call your teammates.

Influence Manager (Large Tech Client)
 
Department: PR & Influence
Location: London
Contract type: 12- Month Fixed-Term Contract
Full Time/Part time: Full Time
Reporting into: Account Director / Business Director
 
About Ogilvy:
Ogilvy UK has been creating iconic ideas that deliver impact at scale for clients ever since David Ogilvy founded the company in 1948. The agency specialises in bringing together brand advertising, customer experience marketing, PR, influence and consulting, all fueled by Behavioural Science. Our world-class award-winning creative campaigns deliver solutions for clients including Sainsburys, Lloyds Banking Group, Madri, Unilever and Mondelz International.
Ogilvys influencer marketing practice is the largest globally and the agency also hosts the worlds biggest festival of behavioural science and creativity, Nudgestock  which is now in its 12th year. James Murphy is the CEO of Ogilvy Group UK, which includes Ogilvy UK and New Commercial Arts (NCA), a boutique creative agency he co-founded in 2020, recently acquired by WPP.
 
The Role:
As an Influence Manager at our agency, you will be an essential part of our influencer proposition, covering the full range of influencer work. Your strategic thinking and creativity will help develop best-in-class ongoing influencer programs for our diverse range of clients, integrating them into the overall strategy for owned, earned, and paid channels.
We work with some of the biggest brands in the world and pride ourselves on our high standards and award-winning work. We are part of the PR, Influence and Social Agency and we work in hybrid teams across clients which helps our specialists have a deep understanding of the earned media approach which benefits our creative strategy and client results.
In this role, you will be responsible for the day-to-day running of influencer campaigns, from identification, vetting, negotiation and implementation to overseeing and reporting. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders  internal and external, to deliver exceptional campaigns for our clients. As part of any role in our team your responsibilities will include managing the influencer database, ensuring it is up-to-date, and staying up-to-date with cultural/social trends and customers' views and attitudes.
We are looking for a self-motivated, action-oriented, and ambitious individual with a positive "can-do" attitude who really understands the landscape and the power and flexibility of influencer campaigns and activations to achieve brand objectives. You will have a keen interest in all things social and be an avid follower of relevant news and trends. You will also have experience in building consistently productive relationships and strong stakeholder management skills. In addition, you should have proven experience in integrating digital and social media into campaign activity.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 To work with the Account Director and Business Director to develop the client portfolio to increase their market share with the influencer strategy
 Actively contribute to the Influencer strategy by recommending objectives, targets, action plans, calendars, and budgets.
 Identify and nurture client-appropriate talent opportunities and relationships to help deliver the influencer program for clients.
 Manage the day-to-day running of influencer campaigns, from identification and implementation to overseeing and reporting.
 Maintain and build successful client relationships, selling in ideas and content streams in quick turnaround and high-pressure situations.
 Present creative and sell content solutions to internal stakeholders and new and existing clients.
 Building client trust and relationships to deliver great results and continue to increase the influence portfolio of brands
 Manage influencer posting across the year, ensuring regulations are met, brand sentiment is high and influencers are brand advocates delivering great work.
 Develop the campaigns, oversee day-to-day operations, keep all admin up to date, and report on data gathered throughout the campaign lifecycle.
 
General Responsibilities:
 Manage influencer and agent relationships and source new relevant influencers
 Stay up-to-date with cultural/social trends and customers' views and attitudes.
 Assist in the development and participation in promoting our influencer offering across the business.
 Support additional projects as required, such as market reviews, and competitive trends.
 A passion for influencer marketing with a minimum of two years' experience in the field.
 Self-motivated, action-oriented, and ambitious with a positive "can-do" attitude.
 A keen interest in all things social and an avid follower of relevant news and trends, being able to keep track of these insights and data uitilising tools such as Microsoft Excel
 
Requirements:
 Ideally experience in working in a category such as tech, lifestyle or similar, essential is a personal interest in these industries
 Ideally experience with influencer marketing software 
 Strong understanding of influencer marketing trends and social media platforms.
 Excellent communication, project management, and organisational skills.
 Experience in a fast-paced agency environment
 Demonstrated experience in building consistently productive relationships.
 The ability to remain optimistic under pressure.
 Strong experience in key stakeholder management.
 A creative outlook with the ability to achieve the full potential from projects, keeping abreast of and utilising new industry developments and technology.
 Proven experience of integrating digital and social media in campaign activity.

Content Strategists are the Content Studio team leaders. Responsible for content direction for all brands and the POC of brand Studio Manager. They will fuel content development with necessary input, clearly designed content strategies to amplify existing ideas.
What Youll Do 

Collaborating with brand teams and development of content plans: As a content strategist you may work closely with brand teams to understand their marketing objectives and develop content strategies that align with those objectives. You will be responsible for developing content plans that outline the types of content that will be produced based on different content typologies, when they will be published, and how they will be distributed, while also ensuring that all content is on-brand and consistent.
Developing and executing content strategies: The content strategist is responsible for developing and executing content strategies that align with the overall business objectives of the content studio. This involves identifying target audiences, conducting research to understand their needs and preferences, and developing content that meets their needs.
Creating content briefs: The content strategist is responsible for creating detailed content briefs that outline the key messaging, tone, and voice for each piece of content. This helps ensure that all content produced by the content studio is on-brand and consistent.
Overseeing content creation: The content strategist works closely with content writers, liquid designers, and other creatives to oversee the creation of all content produced by the content studio. This involves providing feedback and direction to ensure that all content meets the quality standards and objectives of the content studio.
Analyzing and optimizing content: The content strategist is responsible for analyzing the performance of all content produced by the content studio, using metrics such as engagement, traffic, and conversions to determine what is working and what is not. This information is used to optimize future content strategies and improve the effectiveness of the content produced.
Staying up-to-date on industry trends: The content strategist is responsible for staying up-to-date on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to content marketing and content strategy. This ensures that the content studio remains competitive and continues to produce high-quality content that resonates with audiences.

Collaborating with cross-functional teams: The content strategist works closely with other teams within the content studio, as well as external partners, to ensure that all content produced is aligned with the overall business objectives and marketing strategies of the organization.

Strong analytical skills, with an ability to use data to inform content decisions.
